paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 R2645G variant, its functional implications, and potential clinical significance in breast cancer.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here, we report that the variant R2645G, identified in breast cancer...

functional_data.summary: The R2645G variant increases ssDNA binding activity and induces a hyper-recombination phenotype.
assays: viability assays in mouse embryonic stem cells

variants.segregation_data: The variant was identified in a breast cancer patient, suggesting potential segregation with disease.
variants.additional_notes: The variant's effects on DNA binding and recombination suggest a role in cancer predisposition.
key_quotes: This function is executed in part by its canonical DNA binding domain located at the C-terminus.
Human cells expressing this variant display a hyper-recombination phenotype.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly described in the text.
